Mama asked you to turn the dirt in her garden and you told her, with your smart ass self, that you weren't a farmer; get Junior to do it. Every time someone asks you to do something, you always say, tell Junior to do it. Boy, you ought to grow up.

I told you about calling me boy. I ain't no boy. See, you and Dad got a bad habit of calling me boy. You call me boy in front of my wife. You think I'm going to fix the roof? I hope the wind blows the whole damn thing off and it pours down rain.
I ought to break your damn neck.

Sunny is sitting in a chair listening to his father and u argue in the kitchen. A car outside passes and the lights from the car form a crochet-like moving pattern on the wa behind him. Sunny is only lit for a moment.
Babe Brother starts gathering up his things to leave.
I'm leaving and don't even call me when the shoe falls 'cause all he did for me was to try and run my life. I'm tired of people saying Babe Brother this, Babe Brother that. What's my name?
You dumb ass, it's Babe Brother.
My name is Sam. Samuel. Babe Brother attempts to get up but Junior pushes him dow
Sit down! Babe Brother hits Junior on the jaw, driving him backward causing the overhead lamp to sway violently.

sense_profile: the noise coming from the kitch and rush to see what is going on
text: Suzie, Pat and Linda hear the noise coming from the kitch and rush to see what is going on.

sense_profile: to push the knife against his throat
text: Babe Brother and Junior are both reaching for the knife. Junior is on top of Babe Brother, who is stretched out on table trying to reach the knife. Junior grabs the knife f and Babe Brother flips over to defend himself. Babe Broth grabs Junior's wrist as Junior tries to push the knife against his throat. Suzie comes in and grabs part of the knife with her hand Junior's wrist with her other hand. Pat and Linda try to the two men apart while pleading with Junior. Blood drips from Suzie's hand to the table, forming a poo under Babe Brother's head.

Stop it! Stop it! Look what you are doing! Babe Brother's eyes are rolled to the back. Junior's eyes huge; he has an animal look on his face. The SOUND of struggling people breathing heavily is amplified. The poo blood on the table grows larger. Junior slowly becomes aware of the blood and his body relaxes. He calmly releases the knife. Junior takes his mother's hand.

Someone get some lard out of the ice box. Pat attempts to get the lard but pain in her stomach forc her to sit down. Linda gets the lard out and hands it to Junior. Babe Brother raises himself. The blood from Suzie dripping from his head. Rhonda is trying to hold Sunny ba Junior holds his mother's hand under the faucet. It is a cut. The bleeding won't stop. Pat is sitting at the blood-stained table unable to move. is PANTING, sweating, and holding her stomach. Linda is caught between trying to help Suzie and attending to Pat. Babe Brother helps to make a wad of cloth to press in her hand to Stop the bleeding.
You are going to need some stitches. We better take her to the emergency hospital. Babe Brother is shamefully calm now and very humble.
I'll drive her to the hospital.
We will take her. You all stay here and watch Dad.
What about Pat?

I'm okay now. Suzie attempts to go see Gideon but Babe Brother and Juni turn her to the door. Going through the kitchen door, Jun intentionally turns his back to Babe Brother. Babe Brothe stares at Junior's back as he walks ahead.

sense_profile: The automatic doors open and Junior , Babe Brother and Suz
text: The automatic doors open and Junior, Babe Brother and Suz enter. There is a long line of people waiting at the registration window as well as groups of people filling o forms. Other patients are seated and waiting patiently to the doctor. Suzie finally gets to the registration window. A NURSE, white, 25, with extremely long fingernails that curve bac around, is surprisingly sympathetic.
What sort of emergency are you here for?
I cut my hand.

Let me take a look at it. Suzie puts her hand through the window. The Nurse stands to get a better look. The Nurse takes the wad out of her hand. The bleeding has stopped. The Nurse takes a deep breath. The Nurse glances up to no the blood stains on the back of Babe Brother head.
Are you all together?
Yes.
The bleeding has stopped but it will need stitches. You will have to fill out this form. How will this be covered, insurance, cash or check?
Don't worry about it. It will be paid. Just let her see a doctor.
I have Medicare. The Nurse hands Suzie a form, but Babe Brother takes the form. The Nurse looks again at Babe Brother's head.
Do you need to see the doctor too?
No, just my mother. Babe Brother fills out the form with Suzie's help and han the form back to the Nurse. They find a seat all together.
The room slowly fills with people and Babe Brother and Ju offer their seats to those there for medical care.

sense_profile: a man handcuffed to a bed
text: Two Police Officers bring in a man handcuffed to a bed. T woman officer carries a shotgun. The male police officer carries a clip board. The Prisoner is obviously in no condition to escape or cause trouble. They are allowed to directly to the emergency room without waiting.

More injured people come but in spite of their condition are told that they have to wait. There is only standing r Junior and Babe Brother are standing next to the wall. On the other side of the room, Suzie is looking quietly a them as if she is in deep thought. Junior walks over to the reception desk.
Why is it so crowded?
Well, it is Friday night and a full moon. Junior whispers to Babe Brother. They both start to laugh Suzie looks up and finds them in a fit of laughter. A fai smile appears on her face.
Gideon is slowly getting up. He looks around. He calls fo Suzie. He slowly gets to his feet.
Suzie, I'm hungry.
He walks by Linda, Pat, Rhonda, and Sunny, who are sleepi in chairs, on the floor and on the sofa.
Suzie.

sense_profile: taking out bowls food and placing them on the table
text: Gideon opens the refrigerator and starts taking out bowls food and placing them on the table. He puts on a pot of coffee.
Suzie.
Gideon is busy eating almost everything in sight. A group mystified and sleepy faces appear at the door. Pat, Linda Rhonda and Sunny are all looking rather dumbfounded.

Everything is wet from the night's rain. The garden looks more like a graveyard. Moisture drips from the sunflowers Gideon's nervous looking rooster jumps the fence and star to CROW. Skip is out early throwing rocks at his birds. The rocks on Gideon's roof.
Babe Brother and Junior help Suzie out of the car. She ha her left hand bandaged. They are extremely exhausted. The walk up the porch to find Harry holding the door open.
I can't believe what I heard took place.
On seeing Suzie, Sunny jumps up, knocking the can of marb over the kitchen floor. He runs to give Suzie a hug. Sunn wants to touch her bandaged hand, but Linda stops him.
How is Gideon doing?
He is asleep now, but he was up all night eating. As Suzie goes to Gideon's room, she comes face to face wi Harry. She doesn't say anything.
I came to pick up my things.
Gideon is SNORING loudly. On the night-stand is a plate w food left on it. Suzie feels his forehead.
Harry sadly gets up. He looks at Babe Brother. Linda step front of Babe Brother.

You ought to go see how your father is doing and then wash that blood off you and change shirts. Babe Brother is surrounded by Linda and Sunny who has his eyes fixed on Harry. They move as one heading for the bedroom. Harry seems a lot older. He sadly walks towards the kitch with his coffee cup. LOW ANGLE SHOT: Harry is slowly walking towards the MARBL that are scattered over the kitchen floor.
Pat, Linda, Junior, Rhonda, Babe Brother, Sunny and Suzie all standing around waiting for Gideon to wake up.
Gideon. Gideon's only response is to SNORE louder.
How long is Harry going to hang around? Babe Brother is in a corner all by himself. He looks down when Pat asks the question about Harry. A loud CRASHING SOUND comes from the kitchen.

sense_profile: to see if he is alive
to give h mouth to mouth resuscitation
to push down on Harry 's chest
slowly ba into the living room
text: Harry is trying to raise himself from the floor. He pause for a moment and then collapses. Harry is in a lot of pai Harry's body contorts and then remains still. Babe Brother, Junior, Pat, and Linda, Suzie run in. Suzie tries to see if he is alive. Babe Brother tries to give h mouth to mouth resuscitation but Linda pulls him away. Ju tries to push down on Harry's chest. Babe Brother stares down at Harry and then goes slowly ba into the living room. Pat is on the phone dialing the paramedics. Everyone stands around Harry.

Two PARAMEDICS work on Harry. One of the paramedics is a young Asian. The other is white with red hair. They liste for a heart beat and shake their heads in a negative mann They pack up their medical case. The Asian's accent is ve difficult to understand.
There is nothing we can do for him. The Paramedics start to leave without the body.
Well, aren't you going to take him with you?
If he had died in our care, we would be required to take him. Since we found him dead, you will have to wait for the county to pick him up.
How long will that take?
That would depend on how busy it is. I'm sorry.
Harry is stretched out on the floor. A blanket covers everything except his shoes.

sense_profile: Hattie , Marsh , Okra , Herman , and M.C.
text: Hattie, Marsh, Okra, Herman, and M.C. all come in. Marsh looks cheerful.
What happened?
He slipped on some marbles that were on the floor. Then his heart gave out.
(to Sunny) I told you to always put those marbles up and not to leave them just anywhere.
The poor thing is not to blame. Rhonda, take Sunny for a walk. Marsh hands Rhonda several dollars.
Here, go around to the store and buy what you want.
Would anybody object if I take a look at him?
I don't think Harry would like it. Hattie goes over and pulls the blanket back. Okra, M.C. a Herman hurry over to take a quick glance. They huddle beh Hattie, peeping over her shoulder.
I never noticed how big his eyes were.
Linda is helping Babe Brother wash Suzie's blood out of h hair. She dries his hair with a towel. Sonny hands Babe Brother a clean shirt, Gideon's shirt. He puts it on.
Gideon is sitting on the edge of his bed looking through scraps of leftovers on his plate. He puts his pants on. A moves about, his joints SNAP and POP. He picks up the emp plate.
Babe Brother is on the phone with the county morgue. He g into an argument with the people on the other end of the phone.
Mister... Mister... Excuse me for cutting you off but we pay taxes too. We should not have to pay you to take a 24-hour lunch break. Babe Brother hands the phone to Linda.

The coroner said that he was out here, and knocked on the door and no one was here. Junior steps over the body, holding a pot of coffee in hi hand. The Preacher is sitting with Suzie talking in a low voice Pat, Rhonda and Sunny come in with boxes of chicken snack Linda hangs up the phone.
He doesn't know when he will be out this way again. Somebody downtown is going to hear about this.
They just do that in the colored neighborhood. If he had been white, they would had him on his feet and out of here.

I got white meat and I got dark meat. I know it sounds cruel but we have to eat. Gideon comes in walking very slowly, holding his plate ou Everyone is shocked. Gideon is completely unaware of the period that he has been sick.
What, are you having another party?
You better come sit down. You are still sick.
Gal, you're talking to John Henry. When was I sick?
You have been out for almost three weeks. The Preacher gives him a pat on the back and shakes Gideo hand.

We had long conversations with the Lord about you. Didn't we, Sister Suzie? I said we need him down here, Lord. Gideon smiles in appreciation. He pushes his plate out to Pat, indicating that he wants it filled with chicken. Gid is about to bite into the chicken when he notices Harry's feet sticking out. He points with the chicken in his hand has a mystified look on his face.
That's our friend Harry.
Not our Harry?
I wish it wasn't. Gideon seems to weaken for a moment.
What happened to him?
He dropped dead.
Hattie, you can be so mean.
How long has he been dead?
Since this morning.
What happened to your hand?
I cut it on an old rusty knife. Gideon is deeply concerned.
What did you put on it?
It's healing now. Gideon looks over at his two sons as if to ask them about
I hope you will take care of your mother better than that when I'm gone. Junior and Babe Brother both have their heads down. Linda Sunny move closer to Babe Brother.
Babe Brother, is that my shirt that you're wearing?
Yes.
How come you're not wearing my shoes?
They're too big. Gideon stares at Babe Brother and then looks around towar Harry.
When is the undertaker coming?
They can't say. I'll try calling them again. Hattie moves closer to Herman and speaks so only he can h
Why don't M.C. and you drag him to your house? Herman moves away with a look of disdain.
Harry didn't have any relatives living, did he?
Harry was in the world by himself.
Somebody has to take responsibility for him.

Why don't you look through his things to see if you can find a number? Okra, Marsh, Hattie, Herman, and M.C. go to Harry's room, leaving Suzie and Gideon sitting opposite each other with door to the kitchen separating them. Junior, the Preacher Pat are eating chicken. Linda is on the phone trying to g through to the morgue.
How do you like that? They hung up in my face. I'll fix them. I'll show them just how mean I can get. She rapidly dials the number. There is a BUSY SIGNAL.
This has been a nightmare.

sense_profile: old blues records , books , a big Bible , and books on Dunba
text: M.C. and Marsh are going through Harry's boxes. They take old blues records, books, a big Bible, and books on Dunba
These are letters to his son. Hattie reads the letters in a corner by herself. She stop reading for a moment.
I still don't know if I was right about Harry. She seems frustrated with herself not being able to come terms about who was Harry.
A crowd of people are standing around looking at Gideon's house.

The Preacher is sleep in his chair, SNORING loudly. Babe Brother and Linda are sitting together, talking in almost whisper. Sunny is asleep in his lap. Babe Brother is find it difficult to apologize for his recent behavior.
I have more sense than to give up everything, my family, you and Sunny. It wasn't me, I mean the real me inside my body. I'm glad it's over. It's like a veil has been lifted.
Like a veil has been lifted?
It's like I've been swimming in muddy waters.
Like muddy waters?
It was like all those things old country people try to tell you what hell is like.
You were in hell?
I couldn't believe the things I was doing. It was like an internal struggle going on inside my body.
Do you think you won?
It was nip and tuck.
And what lesson have we learned from all of this, Babe Br... Sam... I mean Samuel?
I guess it proves you really care about me. You hung in there. Linda looks at Babe Brother for a length of time.
When are you boys going to fix that roof?
Soon as I rest a bit.  (beat) I meant as soon as we are back to normal again, anytime.
Here I am thinking about myself when poor Harry is resting on the floor of the kitchen.
Harry's body lies there motionless.

The Preacher is SNORING violently. Babe Brother is asleep on the floor. Sunny is asleep sitt on Linda's lap. Linda's feet rest on Babe Brother's chest Junior and Pat are looking at the baby pictures. Pat is holding her hand across her stomach feeling the baby kick Rhonda is asleep in a chair. Suzie and Gideon are sitting at the dining room table. Su is cutting the dead leaves off of a small potted plant.

It feels like a storm has passed... Hattie read some of Harry's letters to a woman he had a child by. The child had died and he was writing to give her some comfort. Hattie didn't know that deep down at the bottom of Harry's hate, there was some love. The SOUND of Rodney's trumpet is heard but is no longer irritating.

Did I ever tell you the story about the man who wanted to make his own mind up about heaven and hell? He didn't want nobody's opinion but his own. Suzie doesn't pay any attention; she is involved with her potted plant. Gideon looks over at the Preacher, who is s asleep.

He's going to check out heaven first. He gets a round trip ticket to heaven. He gets in heaven and finds it just like back home. People dripping with sweat, working in the fields, hardly surviving. He asked a man who was getting a drink of water, "I thought the streets were paved with gold." "They are but you won't see them," he said. "Boy, you got to work day and night cause idleness is sinfulness." So he takes the other half of his ticket and takes the express to hell. He sees people stretched out on their backs kicking back, picking their teeth. "Man, this is a dream." He asked, "What's you'll doing?" They all hollered back, "Sinning." The devil was shaking hands with everyone and came up to him and said, "Please to meet you." He asked, "I thought you'll was supposed to be burning in fire." Someone said, "Man, ain't no fire down here except under that pot of chitlins." The man was going go ask the preacher back on earth...
I don't want to hear any joke about colored people being in hell. You're being irreverent.
I'm almost finished. I'm about to come to the punch line.
I don't want to hear any tales about colored people...
But these are white people, anybody. The punch...
I don't care to hear any jokes about people being in hell. This cut on my hand reminds me that it is nothing to laugh at.

It's only a tale. The RATTLING of pots and dishes starts suddenly. Harry's starts to sway gently as if he were about to get up. Everyone is frozen. Babe Brother and Linda remain asleep. rocking caused by the earthquake doesn't wake them. M.C., Herman, Okra and Hattie and Marsh enters the dining room. Harry's feet are seen in the kitchen still swaying.
Is that an earthquake?
It's something. Babe Brother wakes in a sweat and sits next to Linda like child needing protection.
I'm cold. I need to get out into the sunlight.
What is it, noontime?
I wonder how they going to bury this man.
Plant him in Potter's Field. He doesn't need a marked grave.
Hattie, your true colors are unbearable. You got some mean ways. Don't worry about the boy getting a burial. He still has some friends left on this earth.
His winter has come and gone and I know right now he is answering for a lot of things. M.C., Okra and Herman move away from Hattie.
It is my job to pray for his soul and I would like to do that.

Rhonda is sitting next to Sunny on the front porch. She h an angry expression. Sunny is trying to please her by offering her his airplane. He pushes the airplane near her and she pushes it back wi violent shove. He persists in offering her his airplane. A crowd of people is still standing around in front of Gideon's house.

Hey boy, you still got that dead man in your house. Sunny and Rhonda don't respond. A middle-aged woman, VIRGINIA, one of Gideon's neighbors, passes Sunny and Rho knocks on the screen door and goes in.

I know you all haven't had a chance to cook or do anything with that dead man in your kitchen. You must be starved to death. Some of your neighbors have got together and we set up a picnic table in my backyard with food and everything to feed all you all.
Virginia, that is so wonderful of you all!

If the dead wagon comes, we ought to leave a note telling them we'll be down the street at a picnic. Gideon comes back in with Suzie, who is helping tie his t They all line up and file out the front door with Suzie a Gideon leading the way. Pat is holding her stomach with a thoughtful look on her face.

I think we better be ready. Junior looks concerned as he follows Pat out the door. Su follows Rhonda, who is still mad at him. Babe Brother and Linda are the last ones out. Babe Brother takes a long lo in the direction of Harry as Linda pulls him out. She sla the door.
Harry's body lies on the floor. On the kitchen sink are Suzie's jars of cuttings, which have developed a maze of roots.
